name: 黃琮昇
objective:
This class starts with an introduction to tasks and terminologies of supervision and fault management. The following is a rough description of the material covered in this class.
1. Reliability, Availability and Maintainability
2. Fault Modelling approaches
3. Fault detection methods
4. Fault diagnosis approaches
5. Fault-tolerant system design
schedule:
Week 1: Introduction, Supervision and fault management of processes — tasks and terminology
Week 2: Reliability, Availability and Maintainability (RAM)
Week 3: Safety, Dependability and System Integrity
Week 4: Process Models and Fault Modelling
Week 5: Signal models, Fault detection with limit checking
Week 6: Fault detection with signal models
Week 7: Fault detection with process-identification methods
Week 8: Midterm
Week 9: Fault detection with parity equations
Week 10: Fault detection with state observers and state estimation
Week 11: Fault detection of control loops
Week 12: Fault detection with Principal Component Analysis (PCA)
Week 13: Comparison and combination of fault-detection methods
Week 14: Diagnosis procedures and problems
Week 15: Fault diagnosis with classification methods
Week 16: Fault diagnosis with inference methods
Week 17: Fault-tolerant design, Fault-tolerant components and control
Week 18: Final
materials:
Textbook:
Isermann, Rolf, "Fault-Diagnosis Systems: An Introduction from Fault Detection to Fault Tolerance," Springer, 2006.
